All the fun of playing a rogue/ wm and huge saving throws along with strong melee presence due to high strength and sneak attack/ crippling strike damage.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
A dwarf rogue running around swinging a warhammer. Works for me ;)

Saves typical of a CoT... high. That's a boost in itself.

I'd recommend stocking up on Darkness scrolls, though, or a wand if you can find one. You won't be popping out of stealth mode to surprise anyone. Sneak opps will be scarce. Then again, dwarves are s-o-o-o-o clumsy anyway.

Just a small note about the skills...
Valerfor wrote:
-- clip --
Skill Points: 280 

Spellcraft: 18 (20) cc
Intimidate: 4 (2)
Tumble: 40 (41)
Discipline: 43 (54)
UMD: 37 (35)
Disable Traps: 41 (45)
Open Locks: 9 (10)
Search: 28 (32)
Set Traps: 42 (45) 

SPECIAL NOTES: 

Can Disable Epic Traps
Can Set Epic Traps 


 
34 base ranks (+synergy +Int mod = 38) in Disable Traps is enough to disarm vanilla epics. To recover same, you'd need skill focus to reach 48 (41 base + 2synergy + 2Int mod + 3SkF: DT). Don't see any spare feats so it's just an afterthought on my part. But you effectively have 7 more skill points to play with.

I always shoot for 42 modified ranks in Search so as not to need to wait for the OnHeartbeat check to finally spot the epics. I'm not much for crawling around waiting for the dice to roll in my favor.  Search is VERY important to spot epics in time.  The more, the safer.  

Else, the build is about as far as one can take it IMO. Good work!

P.S. For those who would like to hit the ground running with your build in hand, how about furnishing a skill allotment schedule?

P.P.S. OT:  Check the yardstick thread.  I responded to your post but need some clarification before any measures can be taken.  Glad to see you back in the ECB saddle again.  We missed you!

posts.author: Last Call
posts.content: Alas, Weapon Focus in a melee weapon is a prerequisite for COT. Perhaps drop IKD, and shuffle feats to take an early focus in a simple/rogue weapon to qualify.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Good catch Last Call, build is fixed now, i got weapon focus in rapiers so to qualify for CoT, unfortunately i had to drop improved knockdown for this, although he still has the simple version of it.

HipMaestro, very good point about the search skill, i modified the ranks according to your suggestions, giving him the spare 7 ranks from disable trap and taking 3 more from open locks. He has umd anyway for scrolls of knock should he need them.

It is good to see you all too :)

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
I thought these stocky fellows had Stonecunning for that additional +2, but looking again at NwN Wiki it may not apply to all situations, better be safe than sorry i guess.




 
I'm running into a similar situation with druid's Nature Sense atm. If a bonus is dependent on a tileset to be realized, it's usually best to list both numbers and the qualifier ID (like stonecunning). If I'm really lazy, I'll just ignore the terrain checks altogether and display only the stats that exist everywhere within the module or server environments, leaving players to notice the slight boost themselves as they enter the applicable areas, if they do at all.

P.S.  I'll be sure to send your regards along to Kamiryn, designer of the fabulous CBC.  All I did was click and drag a few cells and paste the result here.  Glad you could use it!
